content.description: Obvious line on the Crackly Cave Boulder above the west parking area in the West Forest. In the pit move up to the left, then right to wedge hold. Throw for lip and mantle up over ledge.
content.protection: Pad the surrounding boulders and the pit.
content.location: From the upper west parking area walk straight up into the woods. The crackly cave is a smallish boulder above the large obelisk boulder.

content.description: Fantastic direct route out of the pit on the crackly cave boulder in the west forest. Start on the obvious ledge/crack and move up to a shallow crimp. Next, reach up to the smooth wedge hold and throw for the lip. Finish with a mantle over the ledge.
content.protection: Pad the pit and surrounding rock. A good spotter is nice on this problem. You end up committing to a horizontal move and risk cratering into the peripheral boulders.
content.location: From the upper west parking area walk east about 20 meters and then straight up into the woods for about 3 minutes. The crackly cave is a smallish boulder just uphill and to the right of the large obelisk boulder.

content.description: SDS under the roof as far back as you can go and match hands where the horizontal roof crack widens to a sidepull/undercling.  Follow crack out of roof and match on nice hold at lip; heel hook and reach up for sloping lip.  Follow sloping lip up and to the right.  Mantle up to large hold and top out.  Super fun moves and awesome problem!! Named after Squamish's Crackhead due to similarity but smaller and tougher.
content.protection: Couple of pads and a spotter.
content.location:
In west forest parking lot walk about 20 meters and then straight up.  On the same boulder as

Levitation

but on the southeast face.
